Create a personalized menu: Take into account everyone's dietary restrictions and preferences, and create a customized menu that caters to everyone's needs. For example, if someone is vegetarian, you could include a roasted vegetable dish or a hearty vegetable soup.
Plan ahead: Start planning and shopping for ingredients well in advance to avoid last-minute stress and ensure that you have everything you need come dinner time.

Use a slow cooker: A slow cooker is a great way to cook a large meal without having to constantly monitor it. You can put everything in the slow cooker and let it cook slowly throughout the day, freeing up your time to do other things.
Set up a buffet: A buffet is a great way to serve a large group of people. You can set up a variety of dishes and let everyone help themselves to what they want.

Make it a family affair: Involve the entire family in the preparation of the dinner. This can be a great way to bond and spend time together. Assign tasks to each person, such as chopping vegetables or setting the table, and make it a collaborative effort.
